sect1.title: Changes from Version 1.7 to Version 2.1
sect1.para: Version 2.1 of &susemgr; adds the following new features:

formalpara.title: Base system upgrade to &sles; 11 SP3
formalpara.para: The underlying &sles; 11 base system has been upgraded to Service Pack 3 (including updates).

formalpara.title: Upgrade to upstream Spacewalk 2.1
formalpara.para: The &susemgr; code has been updated to reflect the 2.1 release of the upstream Spacewalk project (including updates).

formalpara.title: Non compliant systems
formalpara.para: The semantics of non-compliant systems have changed. A system is considered non-compliant if it has packages installed which are not available in a channel. A non-compliant system cannot be reinstalled. The old semantics looked for packages in all available channels. The new semantics look for packages only in channels assigned to the system.

formalpara.title: Channel synchronisation logging
formalpara.para: Logging of channel synchronisation, triggered by mgr-ncc-sync, was done per channel and sync run. Every new sync created a new log file. A cron job was used to clean up older logs files. With &susemgr; 2.1 there is only one log file per channel. All synchronisation runs for a specific channel log to the same file. Older log files are rotated and compressed now, using logrotate.

formalpara.title: Inter-Server Sync between 1.7 (master) and 2.1 (slave)
formalpara.para: An inter-server synchronization (ISS) between a &susemgr; 1.7 Server as master and a &susemgr; 2.1 Server as client will succeed but generate an error mail to the administrator. The error email is harmless and can be deleted.

formalpara.title: Embedded Oracle DB needs extra permission
formalpara.para: When upgrading a &susemgr; Server with Database 1.7 (using embedded Oracle DB), an additional permission (create role) will be added.

formalpara.title: New package pgtcl
formalpara.para: Stored procedures in PostgreSQL can now be written in the TCL language. The package pgtcl will be added on upgrade.

formalpara.title: Reboot action status is reflected immediately in the Web interface
formalpara.para: The status of a rebooted client is now updated immediately. In the past, there was a delay in the status update.
